org.jooby

Class Err.DefHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jooby.Err.DefHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Err.Handler
    Enclosing class:
    Err 

    public static class Err.DefHandler
extends Object
implements Err.Handler
    Default err handler it does content negotation. On text/html requests the err handler creates an err view and use the Err.toMap() result as model.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    edgar

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(Request req,
                   Response rsp,
                   Err ex)
            throws Throwable
        Description copied from interface: Err.Handler
        Handle a route exception by properly logging the error and sending a err response to the client. Please note you always get an Err whenever you throw it or not. For example if your application throws an IllegalArgumentException exception you will get an Err and you can retrieve the original exception by calling Throwable.getCause(). Jooby always give you an Err with an optional root cause and an associated status code.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface  Err.Handler
        Parameters:
        req - HTTP request.
        rsp - HTTP response.
        ex - Error found and status code.
        Throws:
        Throwable - If something goes wrong.
